citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility failed to contact their attending veterinarian about a goat with a skin condition. An adult goat has dry and flaky
skin with hair loss over his shoulders, neck, and down his back. Although the facility has recognized that this is a recurrent
issue with the goat, there are no instructions in the program of veterinary care on how to treat the skin and when to
contact the attending veterinarian. The facility has not reached out to the attending veterinarian or implemented any
treatment for the skin condition. Failure to contact the attending veterinarian in a timely manner when illness or medical
conditions are identified by the facility can lead to a delay in treatment for the animal with potential worsening of the
condition and unnecessary suffering. Correct by 14 April 2025 by ensuring there is direct and frequent communication
with the attending veterinarian so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-
being can be addressed and treatment implemented as needed.

The record of inventory on hand is missing components of required disposition information. Records indicate that a rabbit
was transferred to a private individual but has no date indicating the animal has left the premises. The records also
indicate a total of 13 chickens present in the inventory but only 12 chickens were present on inspection. Several animals
have documented dispositions but the date doesn't include the year. Accurate records of animals on hand, including
acquisitions and dispositions (purchases/births and sales/deaths) are necessary to assess the health and wellbeing of the
animals on site and allow tracking of animals being used for regulatory purposes. Correct by 22 April 2025 by ensuring
the inventory of all animals on hand is up to date and all acquisitions and dispositions are being recorded including
animals born on site or any deaths.

There was no readily identifiable attendant present in the petting zoo while approximately five members of the public,
including a small child, were interacting with the animals. During periods of public contact, both the animals and the public
have an increased risk of potential harm and therefore require an attendant present to monitor the interactions. Correct by
14 April 2025 by having a responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable employee or attendant present at all times
during periods of public contact.

There are several areas of the facility in need of repair. In a pen housing three goats, there is an elevated skywalk with
ramps for the animals to climb. The bottom ramp has come loose from one of its connections to the platform, allowing the
ramp to rotate and move and causing a gap in between the ramp and platform. On the second ramp, there is the sharp
point of a nail sticking up from the walking surface where a cleat was present. On two of the higher platforms, wood
boards have rotted away, exposing the screws. In a second pen, housing four sheep, there is a broken fence board
creating a gap where animals could escape the enclosure as well as sharp edges of wood. Sharp surfaces and unstable
facilities can lead to animal injuries while gaps in enclosure fencing can allow an animal to escape, causing unnecessary
discomfort or suffering. Gaps in fencing can also lead to animal escapes. Correct by ensuring housing facilities are
structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the manager.
